intro: Matelea pakaraimensis, commonly known as the Pakaraima moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Guyana Highlands. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong, sweet fragrance. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other flowering plants with toxic properties. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Matelea pakaraimensis is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
